channel.title: Bye, Bye German Hackers?
channel.description:
[img]http://www.makezine.com/blog/1082549438_e9c8607304.jpg[/img] Today in Germany the Hacker Tool Law goes into effect. With the official name of Paragraph 202C it states that it is illegal to possess, use, produce, or distribute a "hacker tool". In theory, law enforcement could come and arrest everyone here at Chaos Communications Camp. A group of hackers gathered in solidarity to protest this law. Hackers in Germany have been protesting the making of this law for the past year and are stunned that it passed and has gone into effect. The term "hacker tool" is left vague. Nmap or other network monitoring system could fall into this category. Software likeKismac, a wifi detection software, closed down today. Phenoelit, a hacker group, also closed down shop and saying goodbye to Germany.
From [url=http://www.makezine.com/blog/archive/2007/08/the_hacker_tool_law_in_ef.html]Here[/url] I guess hackers theoretically could just not use "tools" and stick with old school 'hacking'.

item.title: Bye, Bye German Hackers?
item.dc:creator: @freezepop freezepop5
item.description:
@freezepop wrote:

this is the thing you could ban knives but there wouldnt be less stabbing as it is in my coutry anyway illegal to carry a knife in the streets, same with this if noone knows you dont get caught =]

Read full topic

item.title: Bye, Bye German Hackers?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Erm, this is fucking stupid. The tools that hackers use are the exact same tools that admins use. For example, nmap - used by sysadmins worldwide, also used to break into systems worldwide. (Also used by Trinity in the Matrix 2… to hack :p)

Next we’ll be banning knives - we won’t be able to cut up our dinner anymore, but at least there might be less stabbings!

Read full topic

item.title: Bye, Bye German Hackers?
item.dc:creator: @god_of_ikiliki god of ikiliki
item.description:
@god_of_ikiliki wrote:

[quote=“therealjdb, post:6, topic:132887”][quote author=Kmb link=topic=184138.msg1671463#msg1671463 date=1187017785]
Seriously, this law is nothing but an epic failure. It does not stop the crackers, but most likely will kill the white hat scene in Germany.
[/quote]
Or just dye them black. xD[/quote]
Lmao and let em die

Read full topic

item.title: Bye, Bye German Hackers?
item.dc:creator: @kmb Kmb
item.description:
@kmb wrote:

Buzzy:

Lawl. Those “Hackers” are crackers. And trust me, if they wanted to, they won’t get caught. If it was me, I’d start giving out one time use source codes for uncompiled software. Anyone wants to use, They compile, run, and it would delete from registry and such. Cops find the source, so what, there a prob with the source =)

With the official name of Paragraph 202C it states that it is illegal to possess, use, [b]produce[/b], or distribute a "hacker tool".

Seriously, this law is nothing but an epic failure. It does not stop the crackers, but most likely will kill the white hat scene in Germany.

Read full topic
